critical_code_review_comments: The i18n.js file has COMPLETE translations for all 3 languages (en, es, pt) with all necessary keys
Hero.jsx and Footer.jsx correctly use useTranslation() hook - use these as examples for fixing other components
Pattern to fix: 1) Import useTranslation from 'react-i18next', 2) Add const { t } = useTranslation() in component, 3) Replace hardcoded text with t('key.name')

FAQ.jsx line 9-50: Replace hardcoded faqs array with t() calls using keys like 'faq.q1', 'faq.a1'

context_for_next_testing_agent: The main issue is 5 React components have hardcoded Spanish text instead of using the i18n translation system. The translation keys and translations already exist in /app/frontend/src/i18n.js. The fix pattern is: import useTranslation, call const { t } = useTranslation(), then replace hardcoded strings with t('key.name'). Backend APIs are working 100%. Admin routes /admin/upload and /admin/settings work correctly.

rca_of_the_issue.root_cause: Components Features.jsx, HowItWorks.jsx, Pricing.jsx, FAQ.jsx, and DownloadSection.jsx were built with hardcoded Spanish text in arrays and JSX instead of using the react-i18next translation system. The i18n.js file has all translations ready, but these components never import or use the useTranslation hook.
reproduction_steps: 2. Click language selector (globe icon in header)
4. Observe: Header and Hero section translate correctly
5. Scroll down - Features, How It Works, Pricing, FAQ sections remain in Spanish
rca_of_the_issue.mitigation: Each affected component needs to: 1) Add import { useTranslation } from 'react-i18next', 2) Add const { t } = useTranslation() inside the component function, 3) Replace all hardcoded Spanish strings with t('translation.key') calls using keys from i18n.js
